isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RT-6613 SERIES - DISASSEMBLE - AUXILIARY DRIVE GEAR/CLUTCH GEAR ASSEMBLY

note.para: Assembly should be disassembled only if absolutely necessary. The retaining pin is not reusable and must be replaced.

step1.para: Align one of the holes in the small diameter of the drive gear with the retaining pin of the clutch gear and mount the assembly in a vise ( Figure 142).

figure.caption: Figure 142. Align Hole in Small Diameter of Drive Gear With Retaining Pin of Clutch Gear

step1.para: Remove the bended end of the pin and drive the pin down and through the hole in the drive gear ( Figure 143).

figure.caption: Figure 143. Drive Pin Down and Through Hole in Drive Gear

step1.para: Position the snap ring in the clutch gear so that the retaining pin hole is approximately 1/2 inch from the open section of the snap ring. Insert a small Allen wrench or equivalent into the retaining pin hole and force down so that the snap ring is forced out of the groove. Insert a small screwdriver between the snap ring and clutch gear and pry the snap ring from the groove ( Figure 144).

figure.caption: Figure 144. Pry Snap Ring From Groove

step1.para: Remove the drive gear from the clutch gear and, if necessary, remove the snap ring from the drive gear ( Figure 145).

figure.caption: Figure 145. Remove Drive Gear From Clutch Gear
